thread.title: Family of killed Benghazi contractor still struggling to recover death benefits
thread.title_full: Family of killed Benghazi contractor still struggling to recover death benefits

title: Family of killed Benghazi contractor still struggling to recover death benefits
text:
Family of killed Benghazi contractor ... Family of killed Benghazi contractor still struggling to recover death benefits There are 2 comments on the The Washington Post story from 8 hrs ago, titled Family of killed Benghazi contractor still struggling to recover death benefits . In it, The Washington Post reports that: 
The family of Glen Doherty, one of two CIA contractors killed during the September 2012 Benghazi attacks, is still struggling to collect death benefits from the government to which they say they're entitled. The family's three-year fight is playing out in the courts, in Congress and in the CIA - which has authority to change administrative rules regarding survivor benefits - and is shedding light on a federal law that critics say does not do enough to protect the families of contractors working abroad on dangerous assignments. Join the discussion below, or Read more at The Washington Post.
